contextId.information: This refers to what Peter has just said in the previous verses. AT: "Because of what God has done" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

The things that Peter and the other apostles saw, which he described in the previous verses, confirm what the prophets spoke. This can be stated in active form. AT: "The things that we saw make this prophetic word more sure" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: We have this prophetic word made more sure

contextId.information: This refers to the Old Testament. AT: "the scriptures, which the prophets spoke" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])

This phrase refers to people who recently became believers. The phrase "those who live in error" refers to unbelievers who still live in sin. AT: "people who try to live rightly, instead of living sinfully as they used to and as other people do" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: people who try to escape from those who live in error

contextId.information: Here the word "desires" refers to sinful desires that are opposed to God's will. AT: "living according to their own sinful desires" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: proceed according to their own desires

contextId.information: Because the Lord is patient, the day of judgment has not yet happened. This gives people an opportunity to repent and be saved, as he explained in [[:en:bible:notes:2pe:03:08|3:9]]. AT: "Also, think about the patience of our Lord as giving you an opportunity to repent and be saved" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_explicit]])
contextId.quote: consider the patience of our Lord to be salvation
